input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row.

genome_sheet.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the reference genomes.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

file_prefix.description: Used as a prefix for (merged) output reports

kraken2_db.description: Path to a kraken2 database, can be a directory or *.tar.gz

sp_sources.description: Sources TAXID count table in csv format for sourcepredict

sp_labels.description: Labels for the sources table in csv format for sourcepredict

taxa_sqlite.description: Path to pre-downloaded ~/.etetoolkit/taxa.sqlite file, if not supplied it will be pulled from the test-data repository

taxa_sqlite_traverse_pkl.description: Path to pre-downloaded ~/.etetoolkit/taxa.sqlite.traverse.pkl file, if not supplied it will be pulled from the test-data repository

sam2lca_db.description: Path to pre-downloaded ~/.sam2lca directory, if not supplied a local database will be build from the reference genomes

sam2lca_acc2tax.description: Sam2lca parameter --acc2tax, use default 'adnamap' when no sam2lca_db is supplied, change accordingly for sam2lca_db (e.g. 'nucl')

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

email.description: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits.

email_on_fail.description: This works exactly as with --email, except emails are only sent if the workflow is not successful.

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

custom_config_version.description: Provide git commit id for custom Institutional configs hosted at nf-core/configs. This was implemented for reproducibility purposes. Default: master.

custom_config_base.description: Base path to custom config files.

publish_dir_mode.description: Value passed to Nextflow publishDir directive for publishing results in the output directory. Available: 'symlink', 'rellink', 'link', 'copy', 'copyNoFollow' and 'move' (Default: 'copy').

plaintext_email.description: Set to receive plain-text e-mails instead of HTML formatted.

monochrome_logs.description: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

hook_url.description: Specify YOUR-HOOK-URL to receive notifications from your pipeline in Microsoft Teams or Slack.

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.
